Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees are still battling the Baltimore Orioles for first place in the American League East.
Anthony Volpe has been solid as the leadoff hitter this season in New York.
Juan Soto has a great role in this offense and is on pace for at least 40 home runs and 100 RBIs.
Aaron Judge is one of the best hitters in baseball and could reach 60 home runs by the season's end.
Schmidt is returning from a months-long injury and must perform well before turning it over to a struggling bullpen.
The Cubs are trailing the final wildcard spot by four games and need to start stringing wins together.
Nico Hoerner leads the team in runs and will look to score more in this game.
Ian Happ has already passed 80 RBIs and 80 runs and will look to drive more in.
Cody Bellinger has regressed and will likely not cross 20 home runs or 80 RBIs.
Assad has had two straight quality starts and will face a high-powered Yankees lineup.
The Cubs have not shown they can do much of anything at home this season.
